text.name: sys_description
text.text: The ZX Spectrum is a computer marketed in the UK in 1982. Based on a Zilog Z80 processor running at 3.5 Mhz and 16 or 48 KB RAM extended with the ZX + at 128 KB. The graphics resolution is 256 Ã— 192 pixels and uses a text mode of 32 columns on 24 lines with a choice of eight colors, either normal or bright, which gives sixteen shades. For the sound a simple beeper emitted rudimentary sounds. Some major English video game studios have made their way onto this machine like Rareware, Bullfrog and Shiny. Many Homebrew games are still released today.
